article.headline: Robert Morris 65, Fairleigh Dickinson 50
article.story: HACKENSACK, N.J. -- Russell Johnson recorded a double-double, scoring 15 points and pulling down 11 boards, to lead Robert Morris to a 65-50 win over Fairleigh Dickinson on Thursday night. Gary Wallace added 13 points for the Colonials (11-8, 6-1 Northeast Conference), who have won four in a row. Robert Morris led by seven points at the break and outscored the Knights 33-25 in the second half to seal the win. Wallace led the Colonials by going 6-for-8 from the foul line, as Robert Morris finished 22-for-36 for the stripe (61.1 percent). The Knights were just 14-for-26 from the free throw line (53.8 percent). Robert Morris outrebounded the Knights 46-32, and forced them into 18 turnovers. Terence Grier and Mike Scott scored 16 points apiece to lead the Knights (4-15, 3-4), who have lost three in a row since completing a season-high three-game win streak.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
